verses.verse: Wherefore <WH199>, Job <WH347>, I pray thee, hear <WH8085> my speeches <WH4405>, and hearken <WH238> to all my words <WH1697>.
Behold, now I have opened <WH6605> my mouth <WH6310>, my tongue <WH3956> hath spoken <WH1696> in my mouth <WH2441>. in my mouth: Heb. in my palate
My words <WH561> shall be of the uprightness <WH3476> of my heart <WH3820>: and my lips <WH8193> shall utter <WH4448> knowledge <WH1847> clearly <WH1305>.
The Spirit <WH7307> of God <WH410> hath made <WH6213> me, and the breath <WH5397> of the Almighty <WH7706> hath given me life <WH2421>.
If thou canst <WH3201> answer <WH7725> me, set thy words in order <WH6186> before <WH6440> me, stand up <WH3320>.
Behold, I am according to thy wish <WH6310> in God's <WH410> stead: I also am formed <WH7169> out of the clay <WH2563>. wish: Heb. mouth formed: Heb. cut
Behold, my terror <WH367> shall not make thee afraid <WH1204>, neither shall my hand <WH405> be heavy <WH3513> upon thee.
Surely thou hast spoken <WH559> in mine hearing <WH241>, and I have heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of thy words <WH4405>, saying, hearing: Heb. ears
I am clean <WH2134> without transgression <WH6588>, I am innocent <WH2643>; neither is there iniquity <WH5771> in me.
Behold, he findeth <WH4672> occasions <WH8569> against me, he counteth <WH2803> me for his enemy <WH341>,
He putteth <WH7760> my feet <WH7272> in the stocks <WH5465>, he marketh <WH8104> all my paths <WH734>.
Behold, in this thou art not just <WH6663>: I will answer <WH6030> thee, that God <WH433> is greater <WH7235> than man <WH582>.
Why dost thou strive <WH7378> against him? for he giveth not account <WH6030> of any of his matters <WH1697>. he giveth: Heb. he answereth not
For God <WH410> speaketh <WH1696> once <WH259>, yea twice <WH8147>, yet man perceiveth <WH7789> it not.
In a dream <WH2472>, in a vision <WH2384> of the night <WH3915>, when deep <WH8639> sleep falleth <WH5307> upon men <WH582>, in slumberings <WH8572> upon the bed <WH4904>;
Then he openeth <WH1540> the ears <WH241> of men <WH582>, and sealeth <WH2856> their instruction <WH4561>, he: Heb. he revealeth, or, uncovereth
That he may withdraw <WH5493> man <WH120> from his purpose <WH4639>, and hide <WH3680> pride <WH1466> from man <WH1397>. purpose: Heb. work
He keepeth back <WH2820> his soul <WH5315> from the pit <WH7845>, and his life <WH2416> from perishing <WH5674> by the sword <WH7973>. from perishing: Heb. from passing
He is chastened <WH3198> also with pain <WH4341> upon his bed <WH4904>, and the multitude <WH7230> <WH7379> of his bones <WH6106> with strong <WH386> pain:
So that his life <WH2416> abhorreth <WH2092> bread <WH3899>, and his soul <WH5315> dainty <WH8378> meat <WH3978>. dainty: Heb. meat of desire
His flesh <WH1320> is consumed away <WH3615>, that it cannot be seen <WH7210>; and his bones <WH6106> that were not seen <WH7200> stick out <WH8192> <WH8205>.
Yea, his soul <WH5315> draweth near <WH7126> unto the grave <WH7845>, and his life <WH2416> to the destroyers <WH4191>.
If there <WH3426> be a messenger <WH4397> with him, an interpreter <WH3887>, one <WH259> among a thousand <WH505>, to shew <WH5046> unto man <WH120> his uprightness <WH3476>:
Then he is gracious <WH2603> unto him, and saith <WH559>, Deliver <WH6308> him from going down <WH3381> to the pit <WH7845>: I have found <WH4672> a ransom <WH3724>. a ransom: or, an atonement
His flesh <WH1320> shall be fresher <WH7375> than a child's <WH5290>: he shall return <WH7725> to the days <WH3117> of his youth <WH5934>: a child's: Heb. childhood

He shall pray <WH6279> unto God <WH433>, and he will be favourable <WH7521> unto him: and he shall see <WH7200> his face <WH6440> with joy <WH8643>: for he will render <WH7725> unto man <WH582> his righteousness <WH6666>.

He looketh <WH7789> upon men <WH582>, and if any say <WH559>, I have sinned <WH2398>, and perverted <WH5753> that which was right <WH3477>, and it profited <WH7737> me not; He: or, He shall look upon men, and say
He will deliver <WH6299> his soul <WH5315> from going <WH5674> into the pit <WH7845>, and his life <WH2416> shall see <WH7200> the light <WH216>. He: or, He hath delivered my soul, etc, and my life
Lo, all these things worketh <WH6466> God <WH410> oftentimes <WH6471> <WH7969> with man <WH1397>, oftentimes: Heb. twice and thrice
To bring back <WH7725> his soul <WH5315> from the pit <WH7845>, to be enlightened <WH215> with the light <WH216> of the living <WH2416>.
Mark well <WH7181>, O Job <WH347>, hearken <WH8085> unto me: hold thy peace <WH2790>, and I will speak <WH1696>.
If thou hast <WH3426> any thing to say <WH4405>, answer <WH7725> me: speak <WH1696>, for I desire <WH2654> to justify <WH6663> thee.
If not, hearken <WH8085> unto me: hold thy peace <WH2790>, and I shall teach <WH502> thee wisdom <WH2451>.
